skill.name: book-scaffolding
skill.description:
Plan, structure, and scaffold large educational books using cognitive load management,
just-in-time specification, and pedagogical best practices. Use this skill when planning
multi-part, multi-chapter educational works that require narrative continuity, progressive
complexity, and hands-on exercises. This skill helps create cohesive learning journeys
that balance foundational scaffolding with advanced independence. Activate when tasks
involve structuring books, managing cognitive load across chapters, defining part-level
narratives, or coordinating multi-phase content development workflows.

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation and template skill with no executable code. Contains YAML templates and Python validation scripts that only read files from their own directory using standard library imports. No network calls, no external commands, no file writes outside the skill directory.

content.user_title: Plan educational books with scaffolding patterns
content.value_statement: Planning large educational books is challenging without structure. This skill provides templates, patterns, and validation tools to scaffold multi-chapter learning journeys that manage cognitive load and ensure narrative continuity.
actual_capabilities: Generate book outline templates with parts, chapters, and learning objectives
Validate chapter dependencies and detect circular references
Analyze cognitive load progression across chapters
Apply pedagogical patterns (IBS, MCA, Cookbook, EEE)
Map reading paths and prerequisite chains
Create chapter structure templates with exercises and examples
limitations: Does not write content to external files or repositories
Does not execute code or run tests on user projects
Does not access network resources or APIs
Does not generate AI content without user prompting

use_cases.title: Structure curriculum
use_cases.description: Plan multi-part educational books with progressive complexity and clear learning paths.

use_cases.title: Design documentation
use_cases.description: Create comprehensive technical documentation with consistent chapter structure and cross-references.

use_cases.title: Build learning journeys
use_cases.description: Design course materials that balance theory with practice using proven pedagogical patterns.

prompt_templates.title: Create book outline
prompt_templates.scenario: Starting a new educational book project
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the book-scaffolding skill to create a comprehensive book outline template for [topic]. Include parts, chapters with learning objectives, dependencies, and reading paths.

prompt_templates.title: Validate structure
prompt_templates.prompt: Use book-scaffolding to validate the chapter structure of my book outline. Check for circular dependencies and ensure cognitive load progression is appropriate.

prompt_templates.title: Apply patterns
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me choose the right chapter flow pattern for my [beginner/intermediate/advanced] book on [topic]. Apply the appropriate structure and create chapter templates.

prompt_templates.title: Map prerequisites
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a chapter dependency map for my book on [topic]. Define prerequisite chains, optional chapters, and multiple reading paths for different learner types.

output_examples.input: Create a book outline for teaching Python programming to beginners
output: Part 1: Python Fundamentals (Chapters 1-5, light cognitive load, heavy scaffolding)
Part 2: Core Concepts (Chapters 6-10, moderate load, progressive independence)
Reading paths: Linear for complete beginners, Fast Track for experienced programmers
Chapter 1: Introduction to Python - 3 key concepts, 2 learning objectives, dependencies: none

best_practices: Start with a clear narrative arc that unifies all chapters in a part
Use just-in-time specification - defer part-specific details until needed
Manage cognitive load by introducing concepts progressively from simple to complex
Apply show-then-explain pedagogy with examples before principles
anti_patterns: Creating all part specs upfront before starting implementation
Treating chapters as isolated units without connection mapping

faq.question: What tools is this skill compatible with?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. It provides structured guidance through prompts rather than automated actions.

faq.question: How detailed are the templates?
faq.answer: Templates include full YAML structures with parts, chapters, sections, learning objectives, dependencies, exercises, and cross-references.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with my existing project?
faq.answer: The skill provides guidance and templates. You apply the patterns to your own documents and workflows manually.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: This skill only reads its own templates and documentation. It never accesses your files, network, or external systems.

faq.question: Why are my validation scripts not running?
faq.answer: The Python scripts are examples. To use them, run them directly on your own YAML outline files with Python installed.

faq.question: How is this different from AI writing tools?
faq.answer: This skill plans structure, not writes content. It helps design learning experiences using pedagogical best practices without generating the actual book content.
